Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body and two lateral lugs pointing forwards, one on each side of the nozzle. The filling-hole is surrounded by a raised rim, decorated at its forward edge with a raised boss. The nozzle is round in section and has a raised rim around the wick-hole. The flat base has a raised boss at its forward edge. Four short transverse cuts have been made on the underside of the nozzle after firing. The upper side is covered with red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q550.bis)
